article_title: A Snapshot Of In-House Counsel Compliance In 2014
article_text:
A Snapshot Of In-House Counsel Compliance In 2014

Law360, New York (November 27, 2013, 5:55 PM ET) -- In 2014, the entire world will have its eyes on Brazil. While the country hosts the World Cup and expedites preparations for the 2016 Olympics, in-house lawyers have a different reason to take note. The upcoming year also marks the country’s enactment of its anti-corruption law, which takes effect at the end of January. For in-house counsel doing business in the sixth-largest economy in the world, the law will increase and intensify the precautions their companies need to take to remain compliant in Brazil. article_metadata.description: In many instances, the very businesses still facing time and budgetary constraints that hamper employee understanding of compliance must now add a new layer of comprehension in 2014. The stage is set for a banner enforcement year for regulatory bodies worldwide, says Veta Richardson, president and CEO of the Association of Corporate Counsel.
